OFT current cases

This page lists all current OFT competition and consumer enforcement cases that are in the public domain, and all markets work that the OFT is currently conducting. Details of the current consumer credit cases can be found on the Credit Enforcement pages.

Content on this page ...
  • Current competition enforcement cases
  • Current consumer enforcement cases
  • Markets and other work

Current competition enforcement cases

Back to top

This section lists ongoing investigations which have been formally opened by the OFT under Chapter I or Chapter II of the Competition Act 1998, and/or Article 101 or 102 of the Treaty for the Functioning of the European Union.

Under section 25 of the Competition Act 1998, the OFT may open a formal investigation into the conduct of a party or parties where it has reasonable grounds for suspecting that competition law has been breached.  Once a case is opened, the OFT undertakes a full investigation, in accordance with its procedural guidance, to determine whether it considers the law has been infringed.

Reference made below to any case or party cannot be taken to indicate that the OFT considers that party has in fact acted unlawfully.

The information that the OFT considers it appropriate to disclose publicly may vary from case to case, and over time.

See full OFT briefing note for further information.

Any media enquiries should be directed to a member of our Press Office.
